name: arithmetic
description: Calibration prompts for arithmetic virtual expert router training

positive: Alice has 16 eggs. She gives 3 to Bob and eats 4. How many eggs are left?
A store has 50 apples. 12 are sold and 5 are thrown away. How many remain?
Tom has 100 dollars. He gives 30 to Jane and spends 20 on food. How much does he have?
A tank has 200 liters. 45 liters leak out and 30 are used. How many liters remain?
Sarah has 24 cookies. She gives 6 to Mike, eats 3, and bakes 10 more. How many does she have?
A book costs $15 and a pen costs $3. What is the total?
If you buy 5 items at $12 each plus $8 shipping, what is the total cost?
What is 127 * 89?
A meal costs $24 plus $4 tax and $5 tip. What is the total?
3 apples at $2 each plus 2 oranges at $3 each. Total cost?
A $200 jacket is 25% off. What is the sale price?
Rent increased by 10% from $1500. What is the new rent?
What is 15% of 340?
A $80 item has a 20% discount then 8% tax. Final price?
If a stock goes up 12% from $50, what is the new price?
A car travels at 60 km/h for 2.5 hours. What distance does it cover?
If a pipe fills 5 liters per minute, how long to fill 200 liters?
Running at 8 mph, how far in 45 minutes?
A machine produces 120 widgets per hour. How many in 7.5 hours?
Water flows at 3 gallons per minute. How much in 2 hours?
Tom has 3 times as many books as Jerry. Jerry has 12 books. How many more does Tom have?
Alice scored 85 and Bob scored 72. What is the difference?
Store A charges $45 and Store B charges $38. How much cheaper is Store B?
Team A has 156 points and Team B has 89. How many more does Team A have?
If Mary has twice as many as John, and John has 15, what is the ratio?
